sentences.en: A whiff of cigarette smoke struck his nostrils.
sentences.cn: 一缕香烟钻进他的鼻孔.

sentences.en: A whiff of fresh air cleared his head.
sentences.cn: 他吸了一点新鲜空气后头脑清醒了.

sentences.en: He always retreated emotionally at the first whiff of conflict.
sentences.cn: 只要有一点冲突的迹象,他在感情上就退缩.

sentences.en: He caught a whiff of her perfume.
sentences.cn: 他闻到了她身上的一股香水味。

sentences.en: I caught a whiff of cigar smoke when I entered his room.
sentences.cn: 我走进他的房间时,闻到一股雪茄烟的气味.

sentences.en: I want a whiff of fresh air.
Journalists caught a whiff of scandal and pursued the actress relentlessly.
sentences.cn: 记者抓到了丑闻的一点线索,于是对这个女演员穷追不舍.

sentences.en: Now and again , he caught a whiff of a peculiar smell.
Something good must be cooking; I got a whiff of it.
sentences.cn: 一定在做什么好菜, 我已闻到味道了.

sentences.en: The Hispaniola rolled steadily, dipping her bowsprit nod and then with a whiff of spray.
sentences.cn: 西斯潘尼奥拉号稳稳地向前驶去, 船首的斜桅杆不时被一阵飞溅的浪花打湿.

sentences.en: The TV show had the whiff of hypocrisy and pomposity.
sentences.cn: 这个电视节目有些伪善和夸耀的嫌疑。

sentences.en: There is a whiff of sarcasm in it.
sentences.cn: 这里面带有一点点讥讽的味道.

sentences.en: There is more than a whiff of propaganda.
sentences.cn: 所含之宣传实在不止一点点.

sentences.en: This little whiff of temper seemed to cool Silver down.
sentences.cn: 船长这顿发作似乎让希尔弗平静了许多.

words.tran_cn: 一点点；[船]单人小划艇；琴鲆属鱼；吸气或吹气

trans.tran_cn: 吸气或吹气，一种比目鱼，<口>难闻的气味，小雪茄烟
trans.tran_en: a very slight smell of something
